III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Resident visitation.
Title
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10133
Section (1) A facility shall establish and follow written visitation policy and
Description procedures. The policy shall provide for visits at least weekly
between each resident and the resident's parents, except
where parental rights have been terminated, or the resident's
1

record contains documentation that visitation is detrimental to
the resident.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation After arriving to the facility Youth A's parent was denied visitation
with Youth A because of unspecified disciplinary reasons.
Investigation Youth A’s Mother was interviewed over the phone on
01/29/2025. She reported that her son had been placed at the
facility through his juvenile delinquency case on 01/24/2025. The
mother spoke with the facility that day and was advised that a
visitation could occur on that coming Sunday. She then drove
from their home to the facility on 01/26/2025, approximately a
three-hour drive. When Youth A’s Mother arrived, she spoke with
a male staff and a female supervisor and was informed that she
would not be able to have a visitation with Youth A. It was
explained to her that Youth A had an “infraction” and as a result
would not be able to have visitation. Youth A’s Mother recalled
being upset at this news and asked what could be done to figure
out a way for her to have even a few minutes of a visit. She
recalled the staff telling her that there was nothing that could be
done that day for Youth A to see her. Youth A’s Mother drove
home and made efforts to communicate with facility
administration. As of the date of this interview Youth A’s Mother
reported not having contact with the administration of the
facility. She reported she was enroute to the facility as the
interview occurred to have a visitation with Youth A.
Chief Administrator was interviewed on 01/30/2025 during an
unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. He reported a
consistent recollection of what occurred on 01/26/2025 that led to
Youth A not having a visitation with Youth A’s Mother. Chief
Administrator confirmed Youth A was able to visit with his mother
on 01/29/2025 and plans were being made for additional visits to
occur before his upcoming discharge to an out-of-state residential
treatment program.
Youth A was interviewed on 01/30/2025 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. He confirmed the date that he had
an intended visitation with Youth A’s Mother and what
occurred. Youth A recalled shift change occurring in the mid
afternoon and he was in his room. He had his toothbrush in his
hand and out of boredom Youth A began to rub the end on the
wall, grinding the toothbrush to a pointy edge. Youth A believed
2

after the fact that this object could easily be misunderstood as a
weapon or on object that could be used for self-harm. Youth A
denied he had either of those intentions and stated that he was
only doing this because he was bored. A female staff walked by
and noticed what he was doing. He recalled a supervisor coming
to explain to him that he had to serve a room restriction because
he had made a weapon. Youth A could not recall any of the staff
member’s names that interacted with him. Youth A understood
the consequences and stated that he did not argue, despite
recognizing that the room restriction would cause him to miss his
visitation with his mother. Youth A confirmed he had been able to
have a visitation with Youth A’s Mother’s the day prior to the
interview on 01/29/25.
Youth A’s Probation Officer was interviewed over the phone on
03/07/2025. He reported having no concerns over Youth A’s
placement at the facility and their implementation of parenting
time. He had been made aware by the facility of the concerns and
resulting program discipline for Youth A on the date of Youth A’s
Mother’s first attempted parenting time. Youth A’s Probation
Officer expressed concern Youth A’s Mother had not
communicated well at the beginning of the placement and also
confirmed that he was aware of subsequent successful visits after
the canceled one on 01/26/2025.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 03/19/2025. He
recalled interacting with Youth A’s Mother on 01/26/2025 when
she arrived to visit with Youth A. Staff 1 had been told Youth A
was placed on a room restriction because of concern that he had
made a weapon. Staff 1 recalled Youth A’s Mother being upset
and requesting to speak with a supervisor at that time.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone on 3/19/2025. She
recalled interacting with Youth A on 01/26/2025 when it was
discovered that he had sharpened a toothbrush while in his
room. Supervisor 1 confiscated the toothbrush from Youth A and
asked what he had been doing with it. Youth A responded to her
that he had been bored and had not been intending to make a
weapon. Supervisor 1 noted she did not know Youth A well at that
time because he had been placed at the facility less than two days
earlier. In addition, Supervisor 1 recalled about an hour earlier
Youth A had been doing cartwheels in the living area of the unit
and had not been responding to staff directives. Supervisor 1
reported explaining the resulting room restriction to Youth A, and
he did not argue or protest, nor did he mention the intended visit
with Youth A’s Mother. She recalled this incident occurring
3

minutes prior to Youth A’s mother arriving for the visitation with
Youth A. Supervisor 1 later interacted with Youth A’s Mother
when she arrived at the facility. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A’s
Mother being upset but ultimately understanding, and they
discussed when the next opportunity could occur for a visit with
Youth A.
Documentation reviewed:
• Incident report documentation from the facility dated
01/26/2025 was provided and reviewed. The details in this
documentation were consistent with the interviews provided
by Youth A and Supervisor 1. The documentation was
dated 01/26/2025 at 2:22 pm and the visit was scheduled to
begin at 2:30 pm.
• Facility documentation provided showed in person visits
between Youth A and his mother on the dates of
01/29/2025 and 02/02/2025 during his placement at the
facility from 01/24/2025 through 02/04/2025.
• Facility policy & procedures titled General Operating
Management was provided and reviewed.
o The Disciplinary System section explained what a
Moderate Violation of the facility’s behavior
management program was, including having
restricted items that could be potentially harmful to
staff or youth that could be considered
contraband. Youth can be placed on a room
restriction for this violation, beginning at a two-hour
room restriction.
o The section titled Resident In-Person Visitation
explained that “juveniles on room restriction during
visitation, lose their visitation privileges.” It also
stated that “if parents cannot routinely visit during
one of the two visitation periods, they may contact a
supervisor to make special arrangements for
visitation.”
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed the facility allowed youth
visitation as required per the rule, as Youth A had a visit with his
mother on 01/29/2025 within the first week of his placement
despite the canceled visit on 01/26/2025.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
